title: Where is this Fact?
content:
Mortimer is 9 years old, one year older than Keen. I'm almost positive that the story line says that somewhere, I just can't remember where nor can I find it. Does anyone know where it says that in the Keen games?
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mort.gif[/img] - .... . <> ..- -. .. ...- . .-. ... . <> .. ... <> - --- .- ... -

title: Re: RE:
content:
I can't remember it being mentioned anywhere. I have never heard it. Or then I just can't remember. Horrible! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-surprise.gif[/img] No, I think I'm sure I haven't read it anywhere..3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: hmm
content: I think the only hint we're given about Mortimer's age is the part of the monologue in the Mangling Machine about "the countless swirlies" Billy received.  That would imply that Mortimer is at the very least in the same school as Billy, but doesn't give us anything more specific.

title: Re: hmm
content:
Funny coincidence... if you can call it that.
I was clicking around a few sites to see if there was anything about the age (I didn't and still don't think so), when I noticed the link and realised I hadn't visit [url=http://www.tomtomtom.com/]Tom Hall's site[/url] in a short while.
It's updated never (about 2 years ago I think it was), so I didn't expect anything, but yep, there it was.

The latest update is 2 September 2006, and according to him Deep Thought produced his age as the answer to life, the universe, and everything.
If that update date is right, it seems we now know Tom's birthday.
(I don't think I've ever seen it.)
Also, with the answer, we can calculate when he was born.
I'd give it a try, but I could make a mistake, give the wrong date, and make a fool of myself, and I plan on doing that again another time, not today.

It's not McMire's birthday, but this is also interesting if you ask me.Retodon8
Sheep happens! [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Keen/Graphics/K1_nme_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: hmm
content:

Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: re
content: yeah its really amazing how things go so fast.

title: Re: Where is this Fact?
content:
It would be logical that Mortimer is one year older than Keen because he's has also one IQ grade more. I suspect that he's just a little bit better in everything he does or is.-----------------

title: Re: Where is this Fact?
content:
Somebody posted an interesting theory a couple of years ago. The numbers in 314 sum to Billy's age, thus it's possible that 315 sums to Mort's age. It's an arbitrary idea, but then so are many things in the Keen series.

There's nothing official regarding this, though.

Hmm... I wonder how old Molly is.

title: Re: Where is this Fact?
content:
Hmmm, couldn't remember that theory but it could make sense. Well, yeah, Mortimer kinda feels like being a bully that is just a bit older, so 9 could be a good guess.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Where is this Fact?
content: Dude I was like so certain it said that somewhere, but I checked the endings of K4-6 and other stuff and can't find it. Man, maybe I was remembering wrong.- .... . <> ..- -. .. ...- . .-. ... . <> .. ... <> - --- .- ... -
